meanings.definition: To limit or control the actions or movements of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to restrict the students from running in the hallway.
meanings.sent2: The new rules restrict how late we can stay out on school nights.
meanings.sent3: Trying to restrict a cat's curiosity is like trying to hold water in your hands.
meanings.sent4: The boundaries of the game restrict players to certain areas of the field.
meanings.sent5: The magician used a magic spell to restrict the movements of his assistant.

meanings.definition: To prevent someone from doing something or limit their ability to do something.
meanings.sent1: The lock on the door is meant to restrict unauthorized access to the building.
meanings.sent2: The doctor advised him to restrict his sugar intake to improve his health.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to restrict the birds from reaching the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The storm's damage may restrict our ability to travel for a while.
meanings.sent5: The strict diet plan restricts her from eating any sweets.

meanings.definition: To impose limitations or constraints on something.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to restrict the use of company vehicles to work-related purposes only.
meanings.sent2: The government may restrict the amount of water people can use during a drought.
meanings.sent3: The chef's attempt to restrict the ingredients in the recipe led to an interesting new dish.
meanings.sent4: The artist chose to restrict her color palette to black and white for this painting.
meanings.sent5: The software update will restrict access to certain features for security reasons.
